parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Positions

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Converts position in world space into screen (UI) space. If a specified position is not within the current screen view, an empty array is returned.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[worldToScreen]] position

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> position: [[Array]] - World position 2D [x,y] or [[PositionAGL]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - Screen position [x,y] (see [[SafeZone]] for more info) - [] if not on-screen

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_screenPos = [[worldToScreen]] [[getPos]] soldier1;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_screenPos = [[worldToScreen]] ([[player]] [[modelToWorld]] [0,10,0]);</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[screenToWorld]], [[SafeZone]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on august 19th, 2012 - 19:19 (GMT+1)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]</dt>
<dd class="note"> please take [[SafeZone|safezones]] in consideration: the returned result can be out of the [0,0]..[1,1] range and can also be a filled array even if the position is not displayed on your monitor - this command thinks of triplescreens configurations as well. [] returned = not rendered

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>tkoh</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template></root>
